item.title: Super-loop vs threads
item.description: A pattern that has mostly fallen out of fashion these days is the “super loop”. Consider a system that has numerous operations to perform. These operations are notionally decoupled and so can be run concurrently. The two patterns we are considering here are: Super loop int main() { while(true) { enterLowPowerMode(); checkConditionOne(); checkConditionTwo(); } } Threads int threadOne() { while(true) { checkConditionOne(); } } int threadTwo() { while(true) { checkConditionTwo(); } } int main() { startThread(threadOne); startThread(threadTwo); while(true) { enterLowPowerMode(); } } Both the above snippets logically do the same thing with different runtime behaviours.
